meanings.definition: The act or process of sucking.
meanings.sent1: The baby's suctions on the pacifier were strong.
meanings.sent2: The suctions of the vacuum cleaner picked up the dirt easily.
meanings.sent3: The suctions of the straw made funny noises as he drank.
meanings.sent4: Her suctions on the straw were like a powerful magnet.
meanings.sent5: The suctions of the pump were so effective that it amazed everyone.

meanings.definition: A device that uses suction to remove fluid or debris.
meanings.sent1: The dentist used the suctions to clear the patient's mouth.
meanings.sent2: The suctions in the lab helped in collecting the liquid samples.
meanings.sent3: The suctions in the sink made it look like a science experiment.
meanings.sent4: The suctions of the vacuum were like tiny helpers cleaning up.
meanings.sent5: The suctions of the machine were gentle yet efficient in their task.

meanings.definition: The force that causes a fluid or solid to be drawn into a vacuum.
meanings.sent1: The suctions in the pump were strong enough to lift the water.
meanings.sent2: The suctions created by the straw pulled the liquid up.
meanings.sent3: The suctions in the experiment made the liquid disappear magically.
meanings.sent4: The suctions of the vacuum were like invisible hands grabbing the dust.
meanings.sent5: The suctions of the machine were so powerful that nothing could escape them.
